result.execSummary:
The defendant Ray A. Evans was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Election Fraud-Illegal Voting, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 12.13(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all costs, fees and surcharges, DNA surcharge  by 1/4/2016.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Provide DNA sample, pay surcharge.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms; and that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ray A. Evans

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
As to COUNT 2-
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 2 dismissed but read in for purposes of sentencing.

Defendant Ray A. Evans in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for jury trial. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. State placed negotiations on the record. Plea hearing proceeded.
Defedant sworn in.

As to COUNT 1-
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead NO CONTEST.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court advised defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing and pay a DNA surcharge.

Defendant Ray A. Evans in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Bruce J. Landgraf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for jury trial. State requested an adjournment as its essential witness is ill and in the hospital and unable to appear. Defense counsel moved for dismissal. Court granted the State's request for an adjournment. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Jury trial scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Proposed verdict forms received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
State's Requested Jury Instructions with attached substantive instructions received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
State's Witness List with attached cover letter received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Ray A. Evans in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Bruce J. Landgraf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for final pretrial. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. State placed negotiations on the record. State's offer letter with attachments received and filed. Defendant sworn in. Court will not proceed further with the plea colloquy today for reasons stated on the record and ordered this matter adjourned. Case remains scheduled for jury trial on 8/31/15. Case adjourned to Branch 25.

Defendant Ray A. Evans in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Bruce J. Landgraf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested a trial date.  Parties were advised that as of August 1, 2015, this calendar will be transferred to the Hon. Stephanie G. Rothstein, Branch 25, in Room G55-A of the Criminal Justice Facility.  If there are any motions to be filed, movant must file by 7/24/15; response due by 8/03/15; reply due by 8/10/15.  Court instructed parties that they must their substantive jury instruction(s), jury instructions, witness lists and motions in limine, one week prior to the final pretrial date.  Court ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue.   Final pre-trial scheduled for August 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 31, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Ray A. Evans in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  
Bruce J. Landgraf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Scheduling conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in settlement negotiations. 
Defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter.; date selected before Branch 20.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Ray A. Evans in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Ronald Dague for Bruce J. Landgraf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 3:00 P.M. ON  (06/11/2015). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Ray A. Evans in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Hanna Ritchie Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 6/10/15 @ 1:30 pm
